### Conflicts

* #18750 (build: optionally skip external warnings by vasild)

If you consider this pull request important, please also he
The PR description has been updated on @ryanofsky's [request](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17813#issuecomment-600023429).

Thanks for updating, new description makes this much more understandable. Two things I don't understand:

- Unclear what "adds check for --with-gui values" is means. Is there a new warning or error?
- Paragraph "This PR does not change behavior. The configure script warns..." is confusing because it's unclear whether the warning is new or old. If this isn't changing warnings and errors, then

>    - Unclear what "adds check for --with-gui values" is means. Is there a new warning or error?

There is a new error if value is not expected. PR description has been updated.

>    - Paragraph "This PR does not change behavior. The configure script warns..." is confusing because it's unclear whether the warning is new or old. If this isn't changing warnings and errors, then I don't thi
Rather not. Isn't Qt 6 around the corner?
